contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox MP |honorific-prefix = |name = Julia Drown |honorific-suffix = |image = |constituency_MP = [[Swindon South (UK Parliament constituency)|Swindon South]] |parliament = |majority = |term_start = 1 May 1997 |term_end = 5 May 2005 |predecessor = [[Boundary Commissions (United Kingdom)|Constituency Established]] |successor = [[Anne Snelgrove]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|08|23|df=yes}} |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |birthname = |nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] |party = [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] |otherparty = |spouse = |relations = |children = |residence = |alma_mater = |occupation = |profession = |cabinet = |committees = |portfolio = |religion = |signature = |website = }} '''Julia Kate Drown''' (born 23 August 1962) was the [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] [[member of Parliament]] for [[Swindon South (UK Parliament constituency)|Swindon South]], in south-west [[England]], from [[United Kingdom general election, 1997|1997]] until 2005.<ref>[http://www.theyworkforyou.com/mp/julia_drown/south_swindon Ms Julia Drown] at They Work For You.com</ref> Drown was a [[National Health Service]] accountant<ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/person/1473/julia-drown Julia Drown: Electoral history and profile] at guardian.co.uk (Accessed 12 January 2012)</ref> and member of [[Oxfordshire County Council]] before her election to parliament.<ref>[http://www.hpc-uk.org/aboutus/council/councilmembers/index.asp?id=90 Julia Drown] Health Professions Council website (Accessed 12 January 2012)</ref> A mother of young children, she was at the forefront of campaigns to make Parliament more child-friendly, including the allowing of breast-feeding.<ref>''BBC News'', [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/2174377.stm Julia Drown] 16 October 2002</ref> She stepped down at the [[United Kingdom general election, 2005|2005 election]] to spend more time with her children, although she did not rule out standing again for election at some point in the future. Drown currently (January 2012) holds a number of organisational positions. She is a lay member of the [[Health Professions Council]], chair of the [[Nursing and Midwifery Council]] Audit Sub-Committee, a trustee of the Pension Scheme for the Nursing and Midwifery Council and Associated Employers, a member of the [[Human Fertilisation and Embryology Authority]] Appeals Committee, and a trainer with Cumberlege Connections Ltd (a health sector leadership and training consultancy).<ref>[http://www.hpc-uk.org/aboutus/council/councilmembers/index.asp?id=90 Julia Drown] Health Professions Council website (Accessed 12 January 2012)</ref> == References == {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-par|uk}} {{s-new | constituency }} {{s-ttl | title = [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Swindon South (UK Parliament constituency)|Swindon South]] | years = [[United Kingdom general election, 1997|1997]]–[[United Kingdom general election, 2005|2005]] }} {{s-aft | after = [[Anne Snelgrove]] }} {{S-end}} {{Authority control|VIAF=173292999}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Drown, Julia | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = British politician | DATE OF BIRTH =23 August 1962 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Drown, Julia}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs]] [[Category:Members of the United Kingdom Parliament for English constituencies]] [[Category:British female MPs]] [[Category:UK MPs 1997–2001]] [[Category:UK MPs 2001–2005]] [[Category:Members of Oxfordshire County Council]] {{Labour-UK-MP-stub}}
